page.title: 15GREASLEY PARISH CHURCH
page.content: {Greasley Parish Church}is dedicated to Saint Mary the Virgin.There has been a church on the present site for a thousand years or more and it was mentioned in the original{Domesday {Book.}The chancel walls of the original church can still be seen. Over the centuries many repairs and alterations have been made to the building.In 1910 an organ was given to the church.In 1922 more bells were added to the church and it now has one of the finest set of bells in the Midlands.There are some fine{stained {glass windows}in the church. Some in memory of people killed in both the { {World Wars.}In the churchyard is the grave of{Benjamin Drawbridge}who was a member of{Captain Cook's}crew.The vicar at the moment is the{Reverend {P.G.Walker.
